article: No one in the United States could forget the sorrowful story, April 14th, 1865 _ Abraham Lincoln was murdered. The night after a very busy _ , the President and his wife went to Ford's Theatre in Washington D.C where a new play was to be put on. Near the theatre _ a 25-year-old unsuccessful actor named John Wilkes Booth, who was strongly against the North though he hadn't fought _ the South himself. As the play _ after a moment of rest, Booth came into the theatre. He walked slowly and quietly _ the door through which he could see the President's _ He looked _ carefully so as to find the guards _ task was to protect the President from the enemy. To his joy, there was none of _ and nobody noticed him. He reached the door quickly and began to get hold of the gun _ in his pocket. It was quiet in the theatre and everyone _ his eyes on the stage. Suddenly a terrible sound of _ broke in on the play. It surprised everyone and soon they looked _ where the sound had just come .Smoke was seen coming out of the President's box, where the _ had enjoyed the play. Right away the theatre was full of shouting and excited people. Soldiers hurried in to search the building, but it was too _ ! The murderer had already _ from the box onto the stage, from which then he hurriedly ran out of the theatre and soon disappeared in the _ . The news came that Lincoln, whom the people had _ to love as an inspiring leader and a wise, warm-hearted, honest man, was short in the chest and died early the next morning.
